intro: Bufonia willkommiana, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and grasslands. The plant features palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces showy yellow flowers with a distinctive cup-shaped structure. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many other flowering plants with similar characteristics. Bufonia willkommiana is often used in traditional medicine for its purported therapeutic properties.
